title: Casual Caregiver Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with Human Resources personnel. Asked several questions relating to past experiences. Discussed the company's history in details and opportunities for growth. At the end of the interview a job was offered.
Interview Questions: Q. How would you handle a difficult client?

title: Human Resources Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services
Interview Descriptions: Instead of setting up an interview, they just called me and interviewed me on the spot. They didn't ask if I had time to interview. I assumed they were calling to set up an interview, but that was not the case.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in Recruitment?

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: In this day and age when I can wait weeks to months to hear from employers about job openings, LSS promptly replied to my application and scheduled me for an interview. The process was great

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services
Interview Descriptions: Super great. Very understanding with anxiety during interviews and didn't hold it against me. Very nice and took their time. They worked with me with figuring out a time to interview and they didn't mind my kids playing in the background during phone interview.
Interview Questions: Why I became a certified nurses aide.

title: Director of Marketing and Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: I received a call to schedule a phone screen the day after I submitted an application online; I was called in for the interview within a few days. I was notified of the employer's decision within a week of the interview. I was not the selected candidate, but the interviewer and entire process was very professional, efficient, and they even explained the reason I was not selected (they were moving on with the interviewing process to include candidates that had more experience in that particular role than I did).
Interview Questions: They asked what my strengths and weaknesses were and how I would select between two job offers if I received more than one job offer.

title: Housekeeping Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was sweet short and quick. I really appreciated the lady telling me all I needed to know to join the team of housekeeping workers. She’s definitely setting  her workers up for success.
Interview Questions: What would be a good work schedule?

title: Server Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services
Interview Descriptions: I waited for about 10 minutes. And how about a hour interview. The lady was great. Really hoping I get the job. She made me feel like I was already apart of the their family.
Interview Questions: Questions are different. It just depends on the person

title: CMT Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is short they ask the typical questions that most employers ask in an interview; LIKE How can you benefit the company if hire, where do you see yourself in five years. What did you like about your last job.They will say you question s about how you resolve conflict

title: HOUSEKEEPING ASSOCIATE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services (Town and Country, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I came in, the room had pretty windows and I was met fairly quickly. The woman that met me was from another facility. The questions were concise and she was very nice and encouraging in how far I could go in the company or at my station. I was even offered my asking hourly rate upon accepting the job.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a dispute with a coworker and how you resolved it

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services (Pensacola, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very conversational. Just be yourself and don’t be quick to answer questions. Think before answering the questions. It’s ok to repeat things back to gain clarity. It definitely makes a difference when you ask questions
Interview Questions: What are some of the  Organizations programs

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview first which went well. I was invited to a in person interview 3 days later. The day before my interview I was asked why wasn't I utilizing my BSN. I explained that I majored in Peds and recently loss a child and that mental I couldn't handle it. She stated her boss  looked over my resume and said it didn't make sense that I wasn't using my degree. She then asked me to explain the times and dates that I went to school and the reason again why I didnt want to use my degree. I forgot to email her and got a email a hour before my interview advising that because I didn't email my reasonings they cancelled my interview. I advised her of all the information requested and I explained to her I was no longer interested in the position. Everyday people work jobs thats are not under their degree and its no big deal. I think it is extremely unprofessional the way they handled the whole process.

Once I declined further communication she sent me a email stating they went with a different candidate.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to go above and beyond on your job

title: Dining Services Associate At MV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview process did not take long, applied online on their website. the process was about two weeks. nice place to work for. a lot of activities for the employees
Interview Questions: behavioral interview and questions about my resume

title: Level One Medication Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was easy, almost a joke! I was asked about 2 medication, answered both correctly and don't remember anything else from the interview. I interviewed with the nurse supervisor and the social worker, because the DON was out of town. after the interview they gave me a tour.
Interview Questions: What is Lasix? what is Ativan?

title: Private Duty Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very time consuming.  Phone screening, then interview with  executive director, potential employees, and three department directors.
Interview Questions: What is the first project that you would take on after being hired?

title: Leasing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services
Interview Descriptions: The first Interview went well, although there were two interviewers. It seemed as if I had the job. I was called back for a second interview which seemed ok. I was then asked for references, one of which being my current employer. I didn't feel comfortable with this request because I don't believe my current job would want to see me go considering I am the top earner and I work extremely hard. I received a call 2-3 days after my Interview requesting that I ask my GM to call back for the reference check. He did not do so and I assume I didn't get the job. I called a few days later and now they won't return my calls. Considering that I am still employed and never had a write up, that should be enough. I can not make my GM call you, I apologize. It would have been nice to get a return call.
Interview Questions: What would your average work day here consist off?

title: Community Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lutheran Senior Services (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Work Culture starts off as if it is good but beware of the office staff that will be applying for the same position.  The interview will consist of the Executive Director, residents and HR staff.  Which all are under the control of the executive director.  They will be looking for a black manager as the property is 98% black.  This is what I was told at my interview.  There will be two interviews with the ED and her administrator then a panel.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with all these seniors?  What would you do in the case of a black-out and no air conditioner for the seniors?
